verses.roman:
ātma-sukha-duḥkhe gopīra nāhika vicāra
kṛṣṇa-sukha-hetu ceṣṭā mano-vyavahāra

synonyms: ātma-sukha-duḥkhe—in personal happiness or distress; gopīra—of the gopīs; nāhika—not; vicāra—consideration; kṛṣṇa-sukha-hetu—for the purpose of Lord Kṛṣṇa's happiness; ceṣṭā—activity; manaḥ—of the mind; vyavahāra—the business.
translation: The gopīs do not care for their own pleasures or pains. All their physical and mental activities are directed toward offering enjoyment to Lord Kṛṣṇa.
